client.maritime

Class MaritimeTradeController

  • java.lang.Object
    • client.base.Controller
      • client.maritime.MaritimeTradeController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IController, IMaritimeTradeController, java.util.Observer

    public class MaritimeTradeController
extends Controller
implements IMaritimeTradeController, java.util.Observer
    Implementation for the maritime trade controller

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MaritimeTradeController(IMaritimeTradeView tradeView, IMaritimeTradeOverlay tradeOverlay) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cancelTrade()
      You can click cancel and it will close the modal by calling this function
      IMaritimeTradeOverlay getTradeOverlay()
      Gets the trade overlay
      IMaritimeTradeView getTradeView()
      Gets the trade view
      void makeTrade()
      This method calculates the rate at which you can trade, and then makes the necessary trade based on that number
      void setGetResource(ResourceType resource)
      When you click on a resource to receive from the trade, this method is called.
      void setGiveResource(ResourceType resource)
      When you click on what you want to give up, this method is called.
      void setTradeOverlay(IMaritimeTradeOverlay tradeOverlay)
      Sets your trade overlay
      void startTrade()
      Checks if it is the players turn and if he has enough resources to do a trade
      void unsetGetValue()
      When you click the circle arrow, this method is called which clears your previous choice of a resource to get
      void unsetGiveValue()
      This method is called when you click the reset button and then it returns you to previous view.
      void update(java.util.Observable o, java.lang.Object arg)
      When the observable calls it's notify method, this method is called to ensure that this controller is up to date.

      • unsetGiveValue

        public void unsetGiveValue()
        This method is called when you click the reset button and then it returns you to previous view. The turn thing is technically not needed, but I believe it adds security to our code. Less breaks this way if something goes awry
        Specified by:
        unsetGiveValue in interface IMaritimeTradeController

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable o,
          java.lang.Object arg)
        When the observable calls it's notify method, this method is called to ensure that this controller is up to date. However, most if not all of what this controller needs to know loads when a user clicks on a button rather than from the Client Facade via this function.
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer
        Parameters:
        o -
        arg -
